name: src/mass.js
Mass
description: Class for working with string representations of mass.

unknown.tagValue: {(number|false)} Returns mass represented in it's base mass unit or false.

return.description: Returns mass represented in it's base mass unit or false.

params.name: spaces
params.description: Truthy values will add space between value and signifier.

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "mass.js",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "JavaScript library for parsing and formatting mass units.",
  "homepage": "https://meeklogic.github.io/Mass.js/",
  "main": "./dist/mass.min.js",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "npx webpack --config webpack.config.js",
    "lint": "./node_modules/.bin/eslint --config ./.eslintrc.js ./src",
    "test": "npm run tests",
    "tests": "node ./scripts/tests.js | tap-spec",
    "test:coverage": "npm run tests:coverage",
    "tests:coverage": "npx nyc npm run tests",
    "speed": "npm run performance",
    "performance": "node ./scripts/performance.js",
    "doc": "npm run documentation",
    "docs": "npm run documentation",
    "documentation": "npx esdoc",
    "example": "node ./scripts/example.js"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "weight",
    "conversion",
    "imperial",
    "pound",
    "ounce",
    "mass"
  ],
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/MeekLogic/Mass.js"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/MeekLogic/Mass.js/issues"
  },
  "author": "MeekLogic (Tyler Vigario)",
  "license": "GPL-3.0-only",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.6.4",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.6.3",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.6",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^6.5.1",
    "microtime": "^3.0.0",
    "nyc": "^14.1.1",
    "tap-spec": "^5.0.0",
    "tape": "^4.11.0",
    "uglifyjs-webpack-plugin": "^2.2.0",
    "webpack": "^4.41.2",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.9"
  },
  "dependencies": {},
  "nyc": {
    "include": [
      "**/dist/mass.js"
    ]
  }
}
name: package.json
